thread.title: Russia’s new kind of friends
thread.title_full: Russia’s new kind of friends - The Washington Post

author: John Woodrow Cox
title: Russia’s new kind of friends
text: Vladimir Yakunin pauses during a TV interview in St. Petersburg, Russia, in 2011. (Andrey Rudakov/Andrey Rudakov/Bloomberg) By Anne Applebaum Columnist October 16 at 8:22 PM Follow @anneapplebaum The World Public Forum’s “ Dialogue of Civilizations ” meets every year on the Greek island of Rhodes, under the patronage of its founder, Vladimir Yakunin. Until recently, Yakunin was the chairman of Russian state railways and a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin. Now he has been ejected from Putin’s inner circle, but he still opened the forum in Rhodes this month. When asked, he angrily denied rumors that a hushed-up corruption scandal had led to his fall from grace. Only an “
